segment.source: MD Conversion - Help users connect to their work using VPN profiles with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Help users connect to their work using VPN profiles with Microsoft Intune

segment.source: MD Conversion - Help users connect to their work using VPN profiles with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Help users connect to their work using VPN profiles with Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Virtual Private Networks (VPN) let you give your users secure remote access to your company network.
segment.target: Virtual Private Networks (VPN) let you give your users secure remote access to your company network.

segment.source: Remote users can work as if their device is physically connected to the network.
segment.target: Remote users can work as if their device is physically connected to the network.

segment.source: Devices use a VPN connection profile to initiate a connection with the VPN server.
segment.target: Devices use a VPN connection profile to initiate a connection with the VPN server.

segment.source: to deploy VPN settings to users and devices in your organization.
segment.target: to deploy VPN settings to users and devices in your organization.

segment.source: By deploying these settings, you minimize the end-user effort required to connect to resources on the company network.
segment.target: By deploying these settings, you minimize the end-user effort required to connect to resources on the company network.

segment.source: For example, you want to provision all iOS devices with the settings required to connect to a file share on the corporate network.
segment.target: For example, you want to provision all iOS devices with the settings required to connect to a file share on the corporate network.

segment.source: You create a VPN profile containing the settings necessary to connect to the corporate network and then deploy this profile to all users with iOS devices.
segment.target: You create a VPN profile containing the settings necessary to connect to the corporate network and then deploy this profile to all users with iOS devices.

segment.source: The users will see the VPN connection in the list of available networks and can connect with the minimum of effort.
segment.target: The users will see the VPN connection in the list of available networks and can connect with the minimum of effort.

segment.source: You can configure the following device types with VPN profiles:
segment.target: You can configure the following device types with VPN profiles:

segment.source: Devices that run Android 4 and later
segment.target: Devices that run Android 4 and later

segment.source: Devices that run iOS 7.1 and later
segment.target: Devices that run iOS 7.1 and later

segment.source: Devices that run Max OS X 10.9 and later
segment.target: Devices that run Max OS X 10.9 and later

segment.source: Enrolled devices that run Windows 8.1 and later (includes
segment.target: Enrolled devices that run Windows 8.1 and later (includes

segment.source: Devices that run Windows Phone 8.1 and later
segment.target: Devices that run Windows Phone 8.1 and later

segment.source: Devices that run Windows 10 desktop and mobile.
segment.target: Devices that run Windows 10 desktop and mobile.

segment.source: The VPN profile configuration options will differ depending on the device type you select.
segment.target: The VPN profile configuration options will differ depending on the device type you select.

segment.source: supports creating VPN profiles that use the following connection types:
segment.target: supports creating VPN profiles that use the following connection types:

segment.source: Before you can use VPN profiles deployed to a device, you must install the applicable VPN app for the profile.
segment.target: Before you can use VPN profiles deployed to a device, you must install the applicable VPN app for the profile.

segment.source: You can use the information in the
segment.target: You can use the information in the

segment.source: Deploy apps to mobile devices in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Deploy apps to mobile devices in Microsoft Intune

segment.source: topic to help you deploy the applicable app using
segment.target: topic to help you deploy the applicable app using

segment.source: VPN profiles can use a number of different connection types and protocols from different manufacturers.
segment.target: VPN profiles can use a number of different connection types and protocols from different manufacturers.

segment.source: These connections are typically secured using one of two methods:
segment.target: These connections are typically secured using one of two methods:

segment.source: When you create the VPN profile, you choose a SCEP
segment.target: When you create the VPN profile, you choose a SCEP

segment.source: certificate profile that you have previously created in
segment.target: certificate profile that you have previously created in

segment.source: This is known as the identity certificate and is used to authenticate against a trusted certificate profile (or a root certificate) you created to establish that the user’s device is allowed to connect.
segment.target: This is known as the identity certificate and is used to authenticate against a trusted certificate profile (or a root certificate) you created to establish that the user’s device is allowed to connect.

segment.source: The trusted certificate is deployed to the computer that authenticates the VPN connection, typically, the VPN server.
segment.target: The trusted certificate is deployed to the computer that authenticates the VPN connection, typically, the VPN server.

segment.source: For more information about how to create and use certificate profiles in
segment.target: For more information about how to create and use certificate profiles in

segment.source: Use Microsoft Intune Certificate Profiles to secure access to company resources
segment.target: Use Microsoft Intune Certificate Profiles to secure access to company resources

segment.source: The user authenticates to the VPN server by providing their username and password.
segment.target: The user authenticates to the VPN server by providing their username and password.

segment.source: Select a template for the new policy by expanding the relevant device type, then choose the VPN profile for that device:
segment.target: Select a template for the new policy by expanding the relevant device type, then choose the VPN profile for that device:

segment.source: VPN Profile (Mac OS X 10.9 and later)
segment.target: VPN Profile (Mac OS X 10.9 and later)

segment.source: VPN Profile (Windows 10 Desktop and Mobile and later)
segment.target: VPN Profile (Windows 10 Desktop and Mobile and later)

segment.source: You can only create and deploy a custom VPN profile policy.
segment.target: You can only create and deploy a custom VPN profile policy.

segment.source: For more information about how to create and deploy policies, see the
segment.target: For more information about how to create and deploy policies, see the

segment.source: Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices in Windows Intune
segment.target: Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices in Windows Intune

segment.source: Use the following table to help you configure the VPN profile settings:
segment.target: Use the following table to help you configure the VPN profile settings:

segment.source: Enter a unique name for the VPN profile to help you identify it in the
segment.target: Enter a unique name for the VPN profile to help you identify it in the

segment.source: Provide a description that gives an overview of the VPN profile and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.
segment.target: Provide a description that gives an overview of the VPN profile and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.

segment.source: Specify a name for the VPN profile.
segment.target: Specify a name for the VPN profile.

segment.source: This is the name that users will see in the list of available VPN connections on their devices.
segment.target: This is the name that users will see in the list of available VPN connections on their devices.

segment.source: Select one of the following connection types to use in the VPN profile:
segment.target: Select one of the following connection types to use in the VPN profile:

segment.source: If you do not create a network traffic rule, all protocols, ports and address ranges are enabled.
segment.target: If you do not create a network traffic rule, all protocols, ports and address ranges are enabled.

segment.source: Once you create a rule, only the protocols, ports and address ranges that you specify in that rule or in additional rules will be used by the VPN connection.
segment.target: Once you create a rule, only the protocols, ports and address ranges that you specify in that rule or in additional rules will be used by the VPN connection.

segment.source: Which routes will use the VPN connection.
segment.target: Which routes will use the VPN connection.

segment.source: Which DNS servers are used by the VPN connection once the connection has been established.
segment.target: Which DNS servers are used by the VPN connection once the connection has been established.

segment.source: Here's an example of when you might use corporate boundaries settings.
segment.target: Here's an example of when you might use corporate boundaries settings.

segment.source: If you want to enable VPN only for remote desktop, you would create a network traffic rule that allows traffic for protocol number 27 on external port 3996.
segment.target: If you want to enable VPN only for remote desktop, you would create a network traffic rule that allows traffic for protocol number 27 on external port 3996.

segment.source: No other traffic will use the VPN.
segment.target: No other traffic will use the VPN.

segment.source: Defining routes in corporate boundaries is useful when your VPN connection type does not allow you to define how traffic is handled in split tunneling.
segment.target: Defining routes in corporate boundaries is useful when your VPN connection type does not allow you to define how traffic is handled in split tunneling.

segment.source: to list the routes that will use the VPN.
segment.target: to list the routes that will use the VPN.

segment.source: You can restrict Windows 10 device VPN usage to specific apps by creating a custom OMA-URI setting.
segment.target: You can restrict Windows 10 device VPN usage to specific apps by creating a custom OMA-URI setting.

segment.source: To learn more about customer URI settings see
segment.target: To learn more about customer URI settings see

segment.source: Custom URI settings for Windows 10 devices
segment.target: Custom URI settings for Windows 10 devices

segment.target: The new policy displays in the

segment.source: Deploy the VPN profile to one or more groups of users or devices in your organization.
segment.target: Deploy the VPN profile to one or more groups of users or devices in your organization.

segment.target: For more information about how to deploy policies, see

segment.target: Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune

segment.target: A status summary and alerts on the

segment.target: workspace identify issues with the policy that require your attention.

segment.source: After successful deployment, users will see the VPN connection name you specified in the list of VPN connections on their device.
segment.target: After successful deployment, users will see the VPN connection name you specified in the list of VPN connections on their device.
